727416f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Fresh Pond Road
727416f-a.text:
Netropolitan Avenue, south side, between Fresh Pond Road and
61st Street, showing in their order from fore to background places
either oned or belonging to the following people in 1873, namely;
Harness Shop, J.H. Ellinger, a harness maker; Lipman; F. Eberle,
owned by one Jacoh, and Jacob's Saloon.
1922
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
727416f-a.folder: Metropolitan Avenue & Fresh Pond Road, Queens, NY

727409f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Fresh Pond Road
727409f-a.text:
Metropolitan Avenue, north side, west of Fresh Pond Road, show-
ing the Ditmars house occupying land owned by C.N.Ditmars in 1852.
This house stands near the site of the oli house which in 1877 was
on the east side of Hunters Point Turnpike.
March 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
727409f-a.folder: Metropolitan Avenue & Fresh Pond Road, Queens, NY

727408f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Fresh Pond Road
727408f-a.text:
Netropolitan Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Fresh Pond Road,
showing at the corner the Bushwick Station of the Long Island Rail-
road. This area consisting of 7 3V4 acres was purchased by one
Braujes on June 26, 1862 for 5,252 dollars. About 1 3(G acres were
sold to the Long Island Railroad for about the above amount and
the remmainder in 1909 to the Bushwick Junction Real Estate Co. for
950,000.
1922
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
